verbose_text: The neurotransmitter serotonin (5-HT) or a 5-HT 2 receptor agonist potentiate, while dopamine D1 receptor agonists, N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) - but not kainic acid - as well as adenosine and caffeine inhibit GABA currents in DRG neurons.
